definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: Yes, the seaweed stuff used in sushi rolls is delicious fresh from the pack.
sentences.chinese: 是的，寿司卷所用的包装新鲜海苔。

sentences.english: Add in melted shortening and seaweed to become the cake batter.
sentences.chinese: 加入融化了的白油，海苔，拌匀成蛋糕糊。

sentences.english: s. Dried seaweed, called “nori”, is a popular food in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 干海草，被称为海苔，是日本人的流行食品。

sentences.english: Head to your local Japanese or Asian grocery store and grab some nori.
sentences.chinese: 去本地的日本或者亚洲的杂货店买一些海苔回来吧。

sentences.english: It's probably made with seaweed and sushi.
sentences.chinese: 日式的酒？那八成是海苔跟寿司做的。

sentences.english: It's the seaweed called nori that's used to wrap some sushi, including maki rolls.
sentences.chinese: 所谓的海苔是用于包装寿司卷的紫菜。

sentences.english: Place the nori on a flat surface.
sentences.chinese: 将海苔片铺放在平整的桌面。

sentences.english: Also, feed nori or high vegetation flak food.
sentences.chinese: 还有，喂海苔或高蔬果含量之片状饵料。

sentences.english: Although it is quite drying so you will need some water with it.
sentences.chinese: 因为海苔非常干燥，所以要用一些水把它泡开。

definition: katsuobushi or dried bonito flakes (paper-thin shavings of preserved skipjack tuna)
flavored roasted seaweed/generic term for edible seaweed/Japanese: nori
see 柴魚片|柴鱼片[chai2 yu2 pian4]
fish floss/crisp and flaky shredded dried fish
gimbap (Korean rice roll similar in appearance to sushi)/kimbap
nian gao, New Year cake, typically a sweet, steamed cake made with glutinous rice flour
